div.p: Over 1,000 volunteer opportunities and 40 agencies and projects to choose from.

Make a Difference Day will take place on November 1, 2014! Details on how to register for this day of service can be found at volunteer.uark.edu. Make a Difference Day last year was able to make an economic impact of over $108,000 with over 1,300 Northwest Arkansas community members. Come join us for Make a Difference Day 2014 and help us make a greater impact in our community!

div.h2: Martin Luther King Jr. Day of Service
div.p: Martin Luther King Jr. Day of service takes place in January each year. This is an on campus service event sponsored by the Volunteer Action Center partnering with various agencies from our community. Each year a board is displayed where community members can leave their thoughts on MLK Day, one student quoted, “paving the way; leave a legacy for generations to come. Spark within them a dream, hope, compassion!”

Susan G. Komen Foundation sponsors breast cancer research awareness and fundraising through their over 140 Race for the Cure races across the country. In April, the Ozark Race for the Cure takes place in Rogers, AR. The Volunteer Action center staffs volunteers for race day activities such as face painting, race set up, and registration.

#HogsCare is a week of random acts of kindness and a social media challenge for all community members spreading kindness to their friends and strangers alike. Partnering with the Arkansas Alumni Association, several departments on campus worked to show that Hogs really do Care on this week each spring!
